titleInfo.title: Mayor Briley on the observation deck of Life & Casualty Tower, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1960s

mods.identifier: RG 3 911 Life & Casualty Tower, Mayor Briley on observation deck 009

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Pictured: Nashville Mayor Beverly Briley viewing the downtown area from atop the observation deck of the Life and Casualty Insurance Company, circa the 1960s. This life insurance company, based in Nashville, was founded in 1903 by A. M. Burton, great-grandfather of singer Amy Grant. In 1957 they moved into a new thirty-one-story tower known as the L & C Tower, located at 4th Avenue North and Church Street. The building was briefly the tallest building in the Southeast. Mayor Briley was the first mayor of the newly consolidated metropolitan government of Nashville and Davidson County. A Democrat, he served from 1963 to 1975. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 35 mm slide, filmstrip : b & w.

titleInfo.title: Record Group 3 Metro Davidson County Photographer
